# GitHub Repository Setup Guide

This guide will help you configure the GitHub repository About section and other settings.

## üìù Repository Description

**Recommended Description** (max 350 characters):

```
Audio and video note-taking application with screen recording, playback controls, and topic-based organization. Built with Electron, React, and TypeScript. Features native macOS ScreenCaptureKit integration and SQLite storage.
```

**Alternative Short Version** (if you prefer brevity):

```
Audio/video note-taking app with screen recording and topic organization. Built with Electron + React + TypeScript.
```

**Alternative Long Version** (more descriptive):

```
Professional audio and video note-taking application featuring screen recording, adjustable playback speed, pitch control, and rich text notes with image attachments. Organize recordings by topics with SQLite database. Cross-platform support for macOS, Windows, and Linux.
```

## üåê Website

If you have a website, documentation site, or want to link to releases:

- **Project Website**: (if you have one)
- **Documentation**: Link to GitHub Pages or wiki
- **Latest Release**: `https://github.com/mahmutsalman/notes-audio-video-app/releases/latest`
- **Personal Website**: (your portfolio or blog)

**Recommended**: Leave blank or use releases link if no dedicated website

## ‚öôÔ∏è How to Update on GitHub

### 1. Update Description

1. Go to your repository: https://github.com/mahmutsalman/notes-audio-video-app
2. Click the **‚öôÔ∏è gear icon** next to "About" (top right of the sidebar)
3. Enter the description in the "Description" field
4. Click "Save changes"

### 2. Add Topics

1. In the same "About" settings modal
2. Click in the "Topics" field
3. Start typing and select from suggestions or create new topics
4. Add the recommended topics listed above
5. Click "Save changes"

### 3. Add Website (Optional)

1. In the same "About" settings modal
2. Enter your website URL in the "Website" field
3. Click "Save changes"

### 4. Update Social Preview Image (Optional)

1. Go to Settings ‚Üí General ‚Üí Social preview
2. Upload a custom image (1280√ó640px recommended)
3. This appears when sharing your repo on social media

**Recommended Social Preview**: Screenshot of your app interface

## üìã Checklist

After setup, your About section should show:

- [ ] Concise, informative description
- [ ] 10-20 relevant topics for discoverability
- [ ] Website URL (optional, only if you have one)
- [ ] Links to README, Contributing, Security Policy are visible
- [ ] Repository stats (stars, watchers, forks) are displayed

## üéØ Best Practices

### Description Tips
- **Be Clear**: Describe what the app does in simple terms
- **Include Tech Stack**: Mention key technologies (Electron, React, TypeScript)
- **Highlight Unique Features**: What makes your app special?
- **Keep It Concise**: 1-2 sentences, under 350 characters
- **Use Keywords**: Help people discover your project

### Topics Selection
- **Relevance**: Only use topics directly related to your project
- **Popularity**: Use common topics for better discoverability
- **Specificity**: Mix general (electron, react) with specific (screen-recording)
- **Limit**: 15-20 topics is ideal (too many dilutes focus)

### Website Guidelines
- Only add if you have a dedicated site
- GitHub Pages, ReadTheDocs, or similar is great
- Linking to latest release is acceptable
- Personal portfolio is okay but prefer project-specific

## üîç SEO & Discoverability

Good topics and description help people find your project:

- **Search**: Users searching GitHub for "electron note-taking"
- **Explore**: GitHub Explore page recommendations
- **Dependencies**: Projects using similar tech stack
- **Topics**: Topic pages aggregate related projects

## üìä Repository Metrics

After setup, monitor these metrics:

- **Stars**: Indicates interest and popularity
- **Watchers**: Users tracking your updates
- **Forks**: Developers contributing or using your code
- **Traffic**: Check Insights ‚Üí Traffic for views and clones

## üé® Visual Enhancements

### README Badges (Optional)

Add badges at the top of your README for visual appeal:

```markdown
![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/v/release/mahmutsalman/notes-audio-video-app)
![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/mahmutsalman/notes-audio-video-app)
![Platform](https://img.shields.io/badge/platform-macOS%20%7C%20Windows%20%7C%20Linux-blue)
![Electron](https://img.shields.io/badge/Electron-33-blue)
![React](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-18-blue)
```

### Repository Features to Enable

1. **Discussions**: Enable for community Q&A
2. **Projects**: Track development roadmap
3. **Wiki**: Extended documentation
4. **Releases**: Publish binaries and changelogs
5. **Issues**: Bug reports and feature requests

## üöÄ After Setup

Once configured:

1. Share your repository on social media
2. Submit to relevant lists (Awesome Electron, etc.)
3. Post on Reddit, Hacker News, ProductHunt (if appropriate)
4. Engage with users who star/fork your project
5. Keep README and screenshots updated
